en.1-1: The purpose of the Analytical Approach is to assist countries or regions build, modernize, or strengthen their national or regional biosafety and biosecurity systems to mitigate the risks of a natural, accidental or deliberate release of biological agents. A complete biosafety and biosecurity system encompasses a legal structure that provides a mandate for an oversight program, along with a policy framework, education and training, and a culture of responsible conduct.
en.1-3: Is a modular and scalable policy analysis tool with a biosafety and biosecurity context
en.1-4: Provides a structure for critical thinking that assists with defining country or region-specific issues and identifying feasible policy solutions to root causes
en.1-5: Supports risk management for moderate and high-risk pathogens and toxins using safety and security lenses
en.1-6: Includes practical guidance, an overview of common policy instruments, and options for combining them into a national program
en.1-7: Assists officials to identify and prepare sound recommendations to decision-makers or donors
en.1-8: Throughout, the Analytical Approach stresses the importance of outreach and engagement in an effort to get to know the various people and stakeholders that are implicated and including them in solutions, with a view to sustainability.
en.1-9: The objective of any policy is to create a change in behaviour among a target population, and the Analytical Approach provides a process to identify the desired behavioural change and the tools to bring it about.
en.2-1: This course contains 9 modules and a final quiz. Each module is designed to be flexible and modular to enable countries or regions to enter the methodology at different points depending on their current state.
en.2-3: This module explains how to develop a picture of where, how, and who are using pathogens in your country or region, and what controls exist.
en.2-4: Module 2: Issue Identification, Risk Assessment, and Prioritization
en.2-5: This module explains how to go about the analysis of the situation and regulations in place – what works well, what does not work, who contributes to the issues, and where action needs to be taken.
en.2-6: Module 3: Scope and Objectives for New System Components
en.2-7: This module explains how to make choices on what risks to address, how much impact the national biosafety and biosecurity system will have, and by when.
en.2-9: This module provides an exploration of policy instruments, their pros and cons.
en.2-10: Module 5: Combine Policy Instruments into National System Options
en.2-11: This module explains how to combine policy instruments into coherent national oversight system options.
en.2-13: This module provides considerations on how your framework might be set up in your country/region and the role that senior decision-makers have in this process.
en.2-15: This module explains how you can assess the impact of your final framework.
en.2-17: This module explains how you can consult with those who will be impacted by your framework to increase the chances that what you develop will be realistic, practical, and accepted.
en.2-19: This module explains how to identify frameworks already in place that may work in your country/region (e.g., for ideas and to assess draft framework).

fr.1-1: L’Approche analytique vise à aider les pays et régions à mettre en place, moderniser ou renforcer leurs systèmes nationaux ou régionaux de biosécurité et de biosûreté pour atténuer les risques de libération naturelle, accidentelle ou intentionnelle d’agents biologiques. Un système complet de biosécurité et de biosûreté comprend à la fois une structure juridique qui prévoit un mandat pour un programme de surveillance, un cadre stratégique, de l'éducation et de la formation,et une culture de conduite responsable.
fr.1-3: est un outil modulaire et évolutif d’analyse de politique dans le contexte de la biosécurité et de la biosûreté;
fr.1-4: fournit une structure de réflexion critique qui aide à définir les questions propres à un pays ou une région et à trouver des solutions stratégiques réalisables pour s'attaquer aux causes fondamentales;
fr.1-5: appuie la gestion du risque pour les agents pathogènes et les toxines à risque modéré et élevé en utilisant l’angle de la sécurité et de la sûreté;
fr.1-6: comprend des conseils pratiques, un aperçu des instruments de politique communs et des options pour les combiner en un programme national;
fr.1-7: aide les fonctionnaires à cerner et à préparer des recommandations judicieuses à l'intention des décideurs ou des donateurs.
fr.1-8: Tout au long du processus, l'Approche analytique met l'accent sur l'importance de la sensibilisation et de la mobilisation dans un effort visant à connaître les diverses personnes et intervenants impliquées et à les inclure dans les solutions, en tenant compte de la durabilité.
fr.1-9: L'objectif de toute politique est de créer un changement de comportement au sein d'une population cible, et l'Approche analytique fournit un processus pour cerner le changement de comportement souhaité et les outils pour y parvenir.
